item.title: The Dominance of Jonathan Taylor: Wisconsin Rushers in Context
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Hot Take Alert ðŸ”¥ Jonathan Taylor is on pace to be the greatest running back in Wisconsin football history ðŸ”¥ Over the previous three decades Wisconsin has retained several elite rushers (and offensive lines) to amass several conference championships and Rose Bowl appearances. Even when acknowledging Taylorâ€™s case as a serious Heisman candidate in each of his first two years, proclaiming him the presumptive best running back in Wisconsin football history still feels like a bold proclamation.

item.title: Seasonal Virgin River Narrows Discharge
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: This April Iâ€™m visiting Zion National Park, one of North Americaâ€™s most interesting locations to explore geologic formations. One such venue in the park is an iconic hike referred to as The Narrows: The Narrows in Zion National Park Itâ€™s surely even more sensational in person. Unfortunately, thereâ€™s a catch: the Virgin River, a Colorado river tributary that shaped the distinct rock walls of The Narrows, has seasonal water level changes that can force hikers to trek waist deep in the river or close the route entirely.

item.title: Working with Minor League Similarity Scores
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Similarity scores were created by Bill James to compare the careers of Hall of Fame eligible players.In In the most basic sense, similarity scores use aggregated performance statistics to compare a player's worth for induction into the Hall of Fame. Projection systems follow from this method: Steamer, PECOTA, Marcel, ZiPS, and others use some combination of a player's recent performance, usually the last 3-4 seasons, to project future performance. Depending on the method, a player's base statistics are then modified using typical aging curves, linear weights, regression, and numerous other factors.
